components.description:
A wooden painted horse, found on the carousel at a carnival. Faces to the left-of screen.

A previous version of Windows displayed the carousel horse facing right, which was changed to face left on Windows 10 for cross-platform consistency.
components.title: Carousel Horse

description:
A wooden painted horse, found on the carousel at a carnival. Faces to the left-of screen.

A previous version of Windows displayed the carousel horse facing right, which was changed to face left on Windows 10 for cross-platform consistency.
title: Carousel Horse

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Entertainment symbols

emoji_net_data.name: carousel horse

bn:00093013v: Move oneself into such a position.
Sit and travel on the back of animal, usually while controlling its motions
To transport oneself by sitting on and directing a horse, later also a bicycle etc.
To move oneself into such a position.
To transport oneself by sitting on the back of a horse.

bn:00016181n: An amusement ride consisting of a rotating circular platform with seats for riders.
Carousel; a pleasure ride consisting of a slowly revolving circular platform affixed with various types of seats, frequently horses or other animals, typically found at fairs and amusement parks
A fairground ride also known as a roundabout
A large, rotating machine with seats for children to ride or amusement
A carousel, or merry-go-round, is an amusement ride consisting of a rotating circular platform with seats for riders.
Carousel is a 1945 stage musical by Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II that was adapted from Ferenc Molnar's play Liliom.

bn:00016139n: Festive season which occurs immediately before Lent
A festive season which occurs immediately before Lent.
A festival marked by merrymaking and processions
Carnival is a festive season which occurs immediately before Lent; the main events are usually during February.
A festive occasion marked by parades and sometimes special foods and other entertainment.

bn:00063528n: Any of various breeds of small gentle horses usually less than five feet high at the shoulder
Any of several small breeds of horse with less than 150 cm (14.2 hands 58 inches) at the withers.
A pony is a small horse.
Any of several small breeds of horse under 14.2 hands.

bn:00079075n: A mythical beast resembling a horse with a single, straight, spiraled horn projecting from its forehead.
The unicorn is a legendary animal that has been described since antiquity as a beast with a large, pointed, spiraling horn projecting from its forehead.

Unicorns are legendary and mythical animals, which in European folklore usually resemble a horse with a large, pointed, spiraling horn projecting from its forehead, and sometimes a goat's beard and cloven hooves.
An imaginary creature represented as a white horse with a long horn growing from its forehead
A mythical animal in the form of a horse, with a single twisted horn on the forehead.

bn:00031345n: The horse is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus.
Subspecies of Equus ferus, or the wild horse
Solid-hoofed herbivorous quadruped domesticated since prehistoric times
Horses are large ungulates, which have had a long relationship with human society.
A large animal with four legs of the Equus caballus species which people ride on or use for carrying things or pulling vehicles.
